properties.name: Apop Records ( Columbia, MO )
properties.description: Posted by Dsudorion 807 locust, columbia, MoApop Records is an independently owned and operated record store whose purpose is to make available those recordings that are often over-looked by both the chain stores, and other independent shops. Apop is dedicated to providing the best music, both obscure and popular, to the widest audience possible. While you will find staple indie,punk,rock,etc releases at Apop, you\'ll also see titles available nowhere else. We do not limit what we carry to a specific genre, nor are we concerned with the latest fad, trend, or the fickle taste of the fashion music "underground". In addition to stocking cds and vinyl, one can also find a variety of literature, publications, tracts, and videos. We at Apop do not believe in the censoring of unpopular information and strive to make available products that express a multitude of ideas, beliefs and platforms. We cater neither to the left nor the right; for that matter Apop has no political ties, whatsoever. We are always searching for both new and old music,books,information to distribute, if you think we are missing something let us know. Nothing will be considered taboo. you can also check myspace

properties.name: Athenaeum Nieuwscentrum ( Amsterdam,NL )
properties.description: Posted by Dsudorionhier verkoopt men het tweemaandelijks onafhankelijk toonafgevend tijdschrift over vernieuwende muziek en cultuur GONZO ( circus ) Athenaeum Boekhandel is één van de weinige grote boekhandels in Nederland die nog volstrekt onafhankelijk is, dat wil zeggen die geen deel uitmaakt van een keten of concern en evenmin behoort tot een inkoopcombinatie. Athenaeum nowadays remains one of Holland\'s largest independent bookstores. Its company-structure in fact features a co-ownership by the staff to underline this independent status. Athenaeum Booksellers was founded in 1966, opened its unique "Newscentre" in 1969, a branch in Haarlem in 1988 and started a small campus-store in the local city college in 1998. The Amsterdam bookshop on the lively Spui boasts a large stock not only in the literary field but also in various academic fields, such as (classical and modern) languages and the humanities, keeping in frequent contact with staff of both the University of Amsterdam and Amsterdam’s city college. About 40% of our stock is self-imported. Athenaeum is the preferred supplier of books to many Amsterdam-based cultural and academic institutions. The Athenaeum Nieuwscentrum offers foreign and local newspapers and magazines plus a selection of travel guides and books on design, jazz and pop music. Wat vindt u bij ons? De meest bijzondere tijdschriftencollectie van Nederland. Vanuit heel de wereld hebben wij tijdschriften op het gebied van opinie, politiek, geschiedenis, kunst, lifestyle, muziek, design, architectuur.

properties.name: Brabo Records (Antwerpen, BE )
properties.description: Posted by Dsudorion   Wij zijn dus \'het bruine café\' onder de cd-winkels. We hebben geen blitse, blinkende winkel maar een eerder krakkemikkig interieur, ik denk dat er de laatste dertig jaar niets is veranderd in de winkel en veel opknapbeurten zijn er ook niet geweest. Maar wij vinden dat niet erg, het gaat tenslotte om de muziek en de rest is bijzaak. Onze vaste klanten weten dat en apreciëren dat ook. Het grootste deel van ons aanbod is toch pop-rock (van de niet zo commerciële soort) en alternatief, maar sinds kort is ook onze vinyl-afdeling uitgebreid en die doet het zeker niet slecht. Daarnaast hebben we ook een ruim aanbod aan metal en blues en hebben we ook nog afdelingen punk-hardcore, dance, hiphop, reggae, soul-funk, wereldmuziek dvd\'s en tweedehands cd\'s. Sinds kort zijn we gestart met een webwinkel, nl. www.braborecords.be. Verder denk ik dat de onze grootste troeven onze prijzen en onze goede service zijn. Wij proberen onze klanten zo goed mogelijk te helpen met vb. import-cd\'s en dergelijke. wij werken samen met de grootste groothandelaar van europa en als hij het niet kan leveren, zoeken wij soms nog andere kanalen om onze klanten toch te kunnen helpen. Natuurlijk kunnen we niet alles leveren, maar we doen toch extra ons best. Ook verkoopt men hier het tweemaandelijks onafhankelijk toonafgevend tijdschrift over vernieuwende muziek en cultuur GONZO ( circus ) www.gonzocircus.com

properties.name: Ceiba Records ~ Fashion/Music/Art
properties.description: Posted by Wendolyne 1364 Haight Street, San Francisco CA Say hello to Peter Zeigelmeyer, Proprietor. _________________ For a very long time now, I\'ve been jonesin\' for one of those cool-looking Gado Gado sweatshirts with the tribal design on the sleeves and the long pointy swirly hoods that I see in Ceiba\'s window when I pass by the store...maybe in red. Touring Ceiba with Peter Ziegelmeier and Marie is a worldwide affair: local designers Dreamtime, Eka, and Space Turtle; Hikari from Japan; Psylo/Israel; Gado Gado/Austria; Nuclear Star/Italy; Quantum Leap & Mido from Bali all compete for my Mastercard\'s attention. But my favorite items in the store at the moment has got to be those stash belts by Hipsterr SF (modeled by Marie at right), which are like old-west gun holsters of wonderfully crafted leather but instead of gun holsters you get pockets for all of your raver or just-plain-boring-old-daily needs. These are way hipper than the standard fanny-pack, that\'s for damn sure, and I\'ll bet no one ever broke up with/refused to go out with/beat up someone for wearing a Hipsterr. Furry playa coats by Simone Schulz and an interesting selection of jewlery by Gina Pfanz round out the offerings of a bit of each type of gear you might need for an overnight dance party or just a hard day of urban living. If you\'re wondering where the music comes in, Peter founded Ceiba Records in 1996 and produces psytrance, progressive trance, and downtempo ambient music; listen and buy in the back of the store or on the website.

properties.name: Concerto BV ( Amsterdam,NL )
properties.description: Posted by Dsudorion  Concerto is een begrip. Een wereldzaak. Nostalgisch en tegelijkertijd zijn tijd vooruit. De drukbezochte platenwinkel die op deze plek in één pand in 1955 begon, is uitgegroeid tot een vijf panden omvattende hotspot voor muziekliefhebbers. Het enorme aanbod van zowel nieuwe als tweedehands cd\'s, lp\'s en dvd\'s in alle denkbare genres maakt Concerto de moeite waard voor een leuk dagje winkelen in Amsterdam. Concerto is een zaak waar muziekliefhebbers nog echt de tijd nemen om urenlang door bakken te wroeten om die moeilijk verkrijgbare of zeldzame cd of lp op de kop te tikken. Maar waar ook ´even snel´ het ideale muziekcadeau gekocht kan worden. Concerto heeft teveel specialiteiten om op te noemen, aangezien wij voor elk genre een aparte afdeling hebben. En elke afdeling heeft zijn eigen specialisten die moeiteloos de nieuwste releases presenteren. Concerto verkoopt cd\'s, lp\'s en dvd\'s, zowel nieuw als tweedehands. properties.name: Croxhapox
properties.description: Posted by Dsudorion Lucas Munichstraat 76/82, gentCROXHAPOX is an experimental art house and an open working place for contemporary art, situated in Ghent, Belgium. It was created in 1990 by Hans van Heirseele, Frank Van den Eeckhout and Guido De Bruyn. Intended as a small non-commercial exhibition room, CROXHAPOX evolved through the years towards a multidisciplinary entity, with a particular vision on content and a diversified exhibition policy. Today, CROXHAPOX receives any form of contemporary art, and offers a working space for music, film, poetry and art criticism. In doing so, CROXHAPOX focuses not only on young or less reputed artists, but also aimes at throwing some light on the importance of artistic research and content. In this way CROXHAPOX offers a large potential for experimenting. CROXHAPOX has no commercial activities, nor does it represent any artists, art disciplines or genres, and for this reason is not to be considered a gallery.

properties.name: Discobar (leuven, BE)
properties.description: Posted by Dsudorion  Diestsestraat 148 De muziek komt ons al tegemoet wanneer we deze zaak naderen. Aan opvallende reclame hebben ze hier geen nood. Discobar is niet echt de zaak voor als je op zoek gaat naar de nieuwste cd van Frans Bauer. Er worden vooral vinylplaten verkocht en of we onze testplaten gingen vinden, dat leek van begin af aan al onwaarschijnlijk. Deze zaak was lange tijd voor dj’s dé platenzaak bij uitstek om aan hun materiaal te geraken. En in hun genre zijn ze nog steeds een aantrekpool voor dance- en technoliefhebbers. We stonden nog maar enkele ogenblikken op de rekken te turen, op zoek naar iets van dEUS, Absynthe Minded of rock tout court, of de uitbater schoot ons al te hulp. Daar ging onze dekmantel. Neen, hij kon ons niet helpen met ons lijstje rockplaten. “Hugo Matthysen”, dat kregen we er zelfs niet meer uit. Met de staart tussen de benen dropen we af. Voor de nieuwste cd van je favoriete artiest kan je beter ergens anders terecht. Maar als vinyl en draaitafels tot je natuurlijke werkterrein behoren, dan heb je deze zaak ongetwijfeld al eerder ontdekt.

properties.name: Fort van sjakoo ( Amsterdam, NL )
properties.description: Posted by DsudorionJodenbreestraat 24 1011 NK Amsterdam The Netherlands Boekhandel het Fort van Sjakoo is sinds 1977 gevestigd in het centrum van Amsterdam. Oorspronkelijk in een gekraakt woon-werkpand, op het tracé van een geplande snelweg dwars door de Nieuwmarkt-buurt, en sinds 1988 gelegaliseerd. Vol enthousiasme wordt het Fort momenteel draaiende gehouden door een collektief van zo\'n tien vrijwilligers. Wij zijn er om jou te voorzien van informatie. Van het laatste nieuws tot degelijke achtergrondinformatie en geschiedenis. Een breed scala aan links-politieke en maatschappijkritische onderwerpen vult de winkel. Ook veel aandacht voor buitenlandse uitgaven, muziek en tijdschriften in verschillende talen. Kom eens kijken! Hebben we iets niet dan kunnen we het altijd voor je bestellen. Wij zijn open op: Maandag t/m Vrijdag van 11 tot 18 uur en Zaterdag van 11 tot 17 uur Jodenbreestraat 24 1011 NK Amsterdam The Netherlands Bookshop "het Fort van Sjakoo" is since 1977 situated in the center of Amsterdam. At first in a squatted house on the site of a planned highway through the inner-city and since 1988 legalized. The bookshop is run by a collective of 10 volunteers. We are there to provide you with information ranging from the latest news, background info and history. We have a special focus for foreign publications, music and magazines. Come and visit us. properties.name: K-RAA-K
properties.description: Posted by DsudorionHeernislaan 81,gent,belgium(K-RAA-K)3 is a grass-roots organisation that offers presentation and development possibilities in left field music. It\'s hard to describe the functioning of (K-RAA-K)3 because the combination of our work strategies differs from most other organisations. We see ourselves as a quality platform, a promotor for young artists who are working within uncommon genres as avant-rock, psych, experimental electronica, free-jazz, new folk, improdrones,... We organise small \'lab-evenings\', bigger presentation moments and creation possibilities. With a monthly mini-magazine we also try to support the experimental scene with documentation and promotion. Therefor we could be called a new style music organisation that tries to work within a variety of niches and tries to support those niches and their artists as good as possible. (K-RAA-K)3 and adventure are a synonymic. We want to surprise, present new stuff, or approach music from alternative direction. The most important arguments for our artistic choices are how captivating or innovative the bands are.

properties.name: Lakeshore Alternative Music ( rochester, NY )
properties.description: Posted by Dsudorion 370 Park Avenue, Rochester, NY, 14507In 1985, the Lakeshore Record Exchange was being sold by a man who wanted to retire from the store who had established the business over the course of many years. Another entrepreneur (our man Andrew) bought the Lakeshore Record Exchange and has been managing it ever since. In 1995, when the Internet was still new and eCommerce had yet to become a buzzword, Andrew bought the domain name AlternativeMusic.com and designed a site himself to put on the Internet. From those humble beginnings, AlternativeMusic.com has grown and shifted over the years. Realizing that he didn\'t want AlternativeMusic.com to compete against Internet Giants like Amazon and CDNow (or the many companies that would attempt to de-throne them), he decided that Alternativemusic.com would continue to do what it has always done since it was first born on the internet... It is a place where people can find and buy almost any piece of Alternative Music they want. This niche market has been the core business of AlternativeMusic.com and Lakeshore Record Exchange. Customer service that goes the extra mile and employees that live and love the music are the hallmarks of this business. While at Lakeshore Record Exchange\'s store in Rochester, New York, USA, you can not only buy CD\'s, you can sell them as well. You can listen to almost any item in the store on listening stations located right there in the store. You can buy industry related and alternative culture related magazines, posters, t-shirts, stickers, and more. Lakeshore Record Exchange is a small business that understands its market and who it is serving. It isn\'t pretentious. It doesn\'t have high profit margins, or a corporate attitude. It has been and continues to be about alternative music and helping people find that music. AlternativeMusic.com has a fantastic following on the Internet with alternative music collector\'s who can\'t find what they are lookingfor. To us, that speaks volumes. We would like the chance to serve you also. If you have any suggestions about AlternativeMusic.com, please drop us an email and tell us. If you are ever in the neighborhood, please drop by. We would love to meet you.

properties.name: PSF Modern Music Records - Tokyo, JP
properties.description: Posted by Killdozer Tokyo2-45-11-201 Matsubara Setagaya, Tokyo 156-0043 See website for directions in Engish. Record store for famous PSF label. Psychedelic, free jazz, experimental, noise "The very best in Japanese underground psychedelic music, including High Rise, White Heaven, Ghost, Musica Transonic, Acid Mothers Temple, Keiji Haino, Fushitsusha, and folk legends Kan Mikami and Kazuki Tomokawa. Also available are free jazz and improvisational musicians such as Motoharu Yoshizawa, Masayuki Takayanagi, and Kaoru Abe. In addition are international free style musicians like Harry Bertoia, Charles Gayle, AMM, Borbetomagus and Mike Wilhelm. P.S.F. reveals the depth, diversity and vitality of the Japanese underground music scene. Its archive chronicles a national treasure of free jazz and maverick rock that explodes the myth of Japanese conformity. P.S.F. Records originated in the Tokyo record shop Modern Music, which opened in 1980, and took its name from the 1985 album Psychedelic Speed Freaks by High Rise. At the time there were a lot of innovative groups around who had no chance of being released by a major label. P.S.F. was started out of a desire to capture some of these precious tunes on record. Renowned founder Hideo Ikeezumi says "I only release what I like, and I hope that some of these sounds will appeal to the more discerning listener." P.S.F. also publishes the highly respected G-Modern, a quarterly magazine on avant-garde underground music. "

properties.name: Plaatboef ( Rotterdam, NL )
properties.description: Posted by DsudorionNieuwe binnenweg 81A Rotterdam, The very first "Plaatboef" second hand record shop was opened by Dennis Meijer in the south side of Rotterdam in 1981. Soon after, in 1983, the Plaatboef moved to a small shop close to the centre of town, the Nieuwe Binnenweg 179. The location had been well known for a very famous record store "Bertus" in the 70\'s, now a large record and cd wholesale company. The shop kept on growing and had to move to Nieuwe Binnenweg 81, with 200 m2 floor space, in 1985. We now, in 2006, would like to move to a larger location, if only available in Rotterdam, because of all the records and cd\'s we buy daily. De Plaatboef is easy to reach, either by tram line 4 from Rotterdam Central Station or by car. Tickets for the parkingmeter are only available with a so-called "Chipknip", a digital way of paying or by credit card. A "Chipknip" is available at Nieuwe Binnenweg 127. The Plaatboef always has a stock of about 8000 records, 13000 cd\'s and 1000 DVD\'S of which 90% is second-hand. We also stock a large quantity of 7" and 12" singles. Check our Plaatboef Newslog on the Homepage for the latest info on new stuff. All year round we have a sale of overstock records and cd\'s etc. The Nieuwe Binnenweg is Holland\'s most popular record street, with a total of 8 shops within a few hundred meters from each other. There\'s always something there for you to be found. The staff is multi-langual and speaks English and some German and French. The Plaatboef team is looking forward to see you in the shop. Dennis Meijer hier verkoopt men Gonzo (circus )

properties.description: Posted by Dsudorion kleine berg 53Bergstraat 36B Eindhoven Rare Records was officially founded in June 1994 as a record finding service. Although some of the founders already were busy doing all kind of things in the music business, the first initiative using the name Rare Records was the start of a mail-order service. With customers from Australia to the US, from Russia to South America, Rare Records grew out to be one of the most important record suppliers of many dj\'s and record collectors. After this initial success, Rare Records The All Style Dance Store was started in July 1995. Up till today this is still one of the most important specialized Dance stores in this area, with daily customers from the Netherlands, Belgium, Germany, France and even the UK. Rare Records can be found at two locations. The first is our store in Eindhoven. The second location is our warehouse in Budel. This is the place where your products are ordered, stored and shipped. At our offices in Budel we work very hard to purchase the best releases and make sure they are delivered to you as soon as possible. To serve our customers even better, Rare Records the website was launched. Although not the first record store on the net, Rare Records will sure try to be one of the best. We have tried to create an online store for people who truly love music, but also appreciate good service and fast delivery. When we were developing Rare Web we started thinking what we could do for our customers besides our store. We started discussing a dj community for all dj\'s and artists around the world and slowly but certain Rare DJ was born. At this time we are still improving and developing all our activities to make sure that the future of Rare Records is even better than our history!

properties.name: Rough Trade ( London, UK )
properties.description: Posted by DsudorionRough Trade began trading in 1976 at 202 Kensington Park Road, Notting Hill. Originally specialising in US and Jamaican imports, it soon became one of the leading outlets for the burgeoning punk scene, and subsequently a Mecca for anyone buying or selling new DIY new wave music and fanzines. In 1978, Rough Trade Records was born. The first release was Paris Marquis by Metal Urbain, soon to be followed with releases by Stiff Little Fingers, Swell Maps, The Raincoats, Cabaret Voltaire... A mixture of rapid growth and management inexperience caused the shop and label businesses to separate in 1982. As a result, the shop moved round the corner to 130 Talbot Road and the label went on to sign some band called The Smiths. In 1987, we opened a second store, together with Slam City Skates, at 16 Neal’s Yard, Covent Garden. International stores (Paris and Tokyo) soon followed but under the weight of global recession, closed for lunch and never re-opened. The same fate fell upon the label…Rough Trade Records went out of business in the early 90s, but like a phoenix from the ashes, triumphantly returned nine years later with Geoff Travis once again at the helm. We, Rough Trade shops, celebrated our 25th Anniversary in 2001 with a series of gigs and the release of a commemorative CD compilation. The same year, we also received an award from Music Week in recognition of our unique contribution to the British Music Industry (following the likes of Richard Branson). Earlier last year, we quietly launched The Album Club – a truly unique and original service that manages to distil all of our heritage, experience and expertise, to provide the finest music delivery service available. Together with this, our new store website, plus of course our two London stores, we proudly continue to deliver the definitive music shop experience.

properties.name: Sax (Leuven,BE)
properties.description: Posted by Dsudorionparijsstraat 31 Leuven Geen enkele cd van onze boodschappenlijst werd hier gevonden, maar geen nood. Sax is niet voor niets een speciaalzaak. Wie op zoek gaat naar jazz- of folkmuziek is hier aan het juiste adres. De meest exotische platen liggen hier niet alleen in de bakken, de verkopers kunnen er ook heel wat over vertellen. Jazz is geordend op naam en genre, folk en wereldmuziek kan je ook op land opzoeken. De Franse en Engelse chansons krijgen ook hun plek, dus eigenlijk hadden onze gezochte cd’s hier niet misstaan. Wie ze hier wil kopen, kan ze ook zeker bestellen. Sax is echter vooral bekend om haar tweedehands collectie cd’s en vinyl. Wie na een identiteitscrisis besluit alle dancemuziek te ruilen voor metal, kan hier gouden zaken doen. Omdat andere platenzaken doorverwezen naar Sax om de inmiddels onbeschikbare Matthysen-cd, is de teleurstelling des te groter dat ze ook hier niet in de rekken ligt. Toch laat de baas weten dat we het zeker in het oog moeten houden, want met tweedehandsverkoop weet je nooit wat er binnenvalt. Het valt te betreuren dat de baas tijdens ons bezoek zijn verkoper afsnauwde om een zichtbaar onnozel incident (omwille van pennen die niet op hun plaats lagen). Zulke berispingen horen misschien niet plaats te vinden wanneer er klanten in de zaak staan. Wie daar mee om kan, zal hier zeker fijne snuistermomenten meemaken txt taken from http://www.veto.be/veto/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=37&Itemid=0

Camelback (NW corner of Central and Camelback) Phoenix, AZ 85013 Hours: 11am-8pm Monday to Saturday, 12-6 Sunday 602.248.9461 phone 602.248.9471 fax Stinkweeds is an independently owned and operated music store and website with a serious slant towards independent labels and bands. We\'ve been in business 19 years, and we\'re currently working out of our newest location at Central and Camelback in Phoenix. We have a wide variety of music, including indie-rock, electonica, jazz, blues, alt-country, experimental and reggae. A stage was added in 1996 in order to host in-store performances by bands like Blonde Redhead, Nada Surf, Red House Painters, Folk Implosion and Old Time Relijun. Needless to say, everyone working here has a genuine love of music, and we pride ourselves on helping customers find music they love.

properties.name: Wally's Groove World ( Antwerpen, BE )
properties.description: Posted by Dsudorion  WGW Store Lange Nieuwstraat 126 2000 Antwerpen in the early nineties as the first Deep House label in Belgium. It gained a lot of respect in the business and after numerous successful releases, a few offspring labels appeared in order to promote other music styles such as Break Beat and Tech House. By the end of the nineties Wally’s Groove World counted four sublabels (5 labels in total), an internet website and a second hand vinyl store. Wha? Roots, the more commercially minded sublabel hit the charts with Arsenal in 2003. On the other hand, less and less was released on the original Wally’s Groove World label due to the decreasing demand for house in that period. Early 2004, a new era started for the group as the second hand basement store closed its doors to reopen as a street-level underground dance store selling mostly new releases and dj equipment and a new WGW release is planned for 2005 with Optimus and Mayaku remixes of the Arbeit Adelt hit Death Disco. In 2005 the focus is also set on the internet store. WGW is working on giving the site a new interface, a more sophisticated technical architecture and on collaborations with distributors to increase the web catalogue. These distributor collaborations should multiply the internet database by four to reach around 100.000 records by the end of this summer, and maybe even twice as much when reaching 2006. The goal is to obtain a fully professional extremely user-friendly website offering a huge database of rare, second hand and new releases. Thank you for being patient and remaining loyal to WGW.
